bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, March 29, 1918

div1.p: Blue permits Carter to travel to other states for malaria research.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, March 29, 1918
div1.opener:
JKC
GFC
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
March 29, 1918.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital, Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
Your orders of December 27, 1917, directing you to assume
supervisory charge of the malaria studies and demonstrations in
the States of Kentucky, Maryland, and Virginia, and to travel to
other places in the Southern States upon the receipt of instruct-
ions from the Bureau, are hereby amended so as to authorize your
travel in North Carolina, Ohio and other adjacent states when
necessary, in conducting these studies and demonstrations. Your
status while engaged in this work will be that of special tem-
porary duty.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. Jr. Mrs. The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing in-
structions are hereby authorized.
JSH Moyle
Assistant Secretary.
RB ✓
Received April 9/18/
Norfolk Va
